intro: Peucedanum angelicoides, commonly known as angelica weed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and can be found in meadows, woodland edges, and along roadsides. Its seeds are small and covered in a fine, white powder, which can be dispersed by wind. The plant has a mild, aromatic scent and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
